REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Self Help Group (KIM/1384/15) since 2015 that deals with milk production.
Logic: Established in 2015, they have a decade of continuity. Their membership is stable, suggesting strong internal cohesion and member discipline.
Logic.1: The mpesa statement given is locked hence we ca not verify their position financially.
Logic.2: They have identified a clear catch in traditional products like Mursik and cooking oil from cream. However, their market is currently limited to local consumers. Moving into B2B (hotels/institutions) will require formalization and certification.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: They mention Milking technology and Milk processing technology but lack a detailed budget or specific equipment list. To grow, they need to move from a member's home to a dedicated processing center
Logic.3: Dairy is a prioritized value chain since they have mentioned selling mursik and oil cream this means they process their milk either to oil or fermented milk.
Logic.4: Over 50% of members (10/19) are aged 18–35 and 49% are female(9/19). Their sustainability practices—using solar power and making silage to avoid overgrazing—are excellent green initiatives for a small cluster

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: no-hand written cash flow statement attached
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): MSME Association (Reg. RA-KGSRE5) established in 2025 that deals with poultry farming and apiculture.
Logic: Regestred in 2025.However, the leadership structure is well-defined, and they have clear bylaws.
Logic.1: The financial evidence given(cash flow) given is not offficially recognized hence we can not judge the association's financial position by using it.
Logic.2: The choice to combine poultry and bees is ecologically and economically sound. Bees increase fruit/crop yields in the area, while poultry provides quick cash flow. Their B2B focus (Hotels/Schools) shows an understanding of Value-Volume dynamics.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their 3-year investment plan is realistic. They are starting with production (hives/incubators) and moving into value addition (wax candles/branded honey). The projected margins (30-40%) are healthy for the Bungoma region.The only problem is that they lack a clear budget for the production of beehives and incubators and the wax,branded honey.
Logic.3: They are dealing with poultry keeping and bee keeping (honey harvesting) which are not in any Value Chain that we are evaluating.
Logic.4: 100% women-owned. They have integrated circular economy principles (composting poultry droppings for fertilizer) and climate-resilience (pollinator protection). This is a Green Economy benchmark project.

IF OTHER PVC Which one?: planting of sugarcane and after 8months I harvested and take to factory
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): No regestered certificate to proof if it is a functioning association,no financial evidence to proof if the association is running.
Logic: We can not verify  when was the association started and neither can we verify whether it is running smoothly.
Logic.1: No financial statement given hence no evidence for verifying the financial position for the association.
Logic.2: Sugarcane has high demand in Western Kenya (Nzoia, Mumias factories). However, the applicant lacks a unique selling proposition (USP). The competitive advantage is listed only as "good harvested modules.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The applicant states no to having clear objectives or performance targets. There is no specific equipment list or investment budget provided, which is a requirement for KJET funding
Logic.3: Sugarcane is not a major value chain that the KJET is evaluating hence falling out of the scoope.
Logic.4: While they mention planting more trees, there is no evidence of a systematic green initiative or climate-resilient farming strategy specifically for the sugarcane crop

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Self Help Group (Reg. DSD/39/220/01/144764) established in 2017 that deals with dairy farming (milk production and processing)
Logic: Operating since 2017 with a steady membership increase (from 15 to 30) shows long-term sustainability and local trust.They also have a very organized structure(chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: The Turn Over for 2025 is KSH 63,394 which is way below the 1M threshold.
Logic.2: They have identified a sophisticated gap: the difference between crushed mash and Total Mixed Rations (TMR). By targeting the Dry Season Slump, they are solving the most critical problem for dairy farmers in Bungoma.their market is only in Bungoma,they do not have any market outside Bungoma neither do they have any online customers.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: They aren't just asking for machines ,they are asking for a Moisture Content Tester (to prevent aflatoxin) and a Vertical Mixer (to prevent selective feeding). Their target to triple production to 600kg/day is well-justified,their only problem is they do not have a concrete budget to buy the machines required.
Logic.3: Dairy is a core priority for KJET, and feed represents the highest cost-center for dairy farmers,They manufacture, and process dairy feeds,they are still in the starting process but they have a potential to growth
Logic.4: Strong female representation (26 out of 30 members).Their Green Practices focuses on Waste-to-Feed Upcycling, converting agricultural by-products (maize germ, oilseed cakes) into high-value protein, which prevents methane release from rotting crop residues.

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: yes-mpesa statement and bank statement given.
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments):
Self Help Group (Reg. DSD/39/217/01/74089) since 2022 that deals with commercial production .of high-quality natural milk and the breeding of top-tier dairy heifers
under the zero grazing unit system.
Logic: 3 years of doing business they have scaled from 3 to 10 members
Logic.1: The paid out amount in the bank statement is KSH 602,446 which is way too low 1M threshhold.
Logic.2: They are targeting high-value B2B clients (Colleges, Supermarkets, Hotels). Their strategy to compete with giants like Brookside through Green Leadership and AI Technology shows a modern, disruptive mindset.No any online market for their products.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their request for a "lorry" for a 10-member group may be premature given current revenue levels (KES 320k). However, their focus on a Milk Cooling Machine and Chaff Cutter is perfectly aligned with scaling their current zero-grazing operations.They have an unfinished budget.
Logic.3: Deal with milk production in large quantity.Planning to strt milk processing.
Logic.4: They have implemented a comprehensive green stack: solar energy, biogas, rainwater harvesting, and drought-resistant fodder (Brachiaria). Their 60% female employment rate within a youth group is excellent

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): CBO (Reg. DSD/39/216/02/25954) established in 2024 that deals with milk processing.
Logic: Regestered for 1 year with a working governance(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: Turn over for 2024 is KSH 138,875 which is way lower than the 1M threshhold.
Logic.2: They have identified a high-value niche: Cross-border trade with Uganda. Their proximity to the border and existing B2C trust in local schools and hotels provides a solid foundation for expansion.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their focus on a 1,000L cooler and last-mile motorcycles is the correct intervention for Mt. Elgon’s terrain. Their goal to reduce post-harvest losses to <5% is a high-impact KPI.No budget given.
Logic.3: Dairy is a priority value chain for Bungoma County, especially in the high-altitude Mt. Elgon region.They do not deal with any milk processing.
Logic.4: 93% women membership. Their sustainability practices (manure recycling and drought-tolerant fodder like Brachiaria) are well-aligned with climate-smart agriculture

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: no-bank statement with very few transactions attached
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email adress given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (Reg. BN-GVCJLLMP) established in 2010 used in sun flower processing.
Logic: Well established company(16 yrs in work) dealing with sun flower processing to oil.
Logic.1: The bank statement given has only 5 days transaction for march 2025, this transacions can not be used to places the company financially.
Logic.2: They correctly identify Oil Seed Cake (animal feed) as a 20% revenue stream, effectively running a zero-waste operation. While they face competition from giants like Bidco, their focus on local B2C (90%) and fresh/pure oil gives them a local competitive edge.No online market
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal highlights that their current technology is not seamless and suffers from breakdowns. Their growth strategy relies on moving from 1-ton to 3-ton daily capacity. They need a more detailed specification for the refining/purification stage to meet KEBS standards consistently. No budget
Logic.3: Edible oils are a high-priority sector for KJET and national food security.They process sun flower seeds to sun flower oil.
Logic.4: 50% women involved,50% youth involved Their Green Initiative includes agro-ecological farming and bio-char production,they did not say how this agro-ecological farming will help the environment.

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email adress given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Company Limited by Guarantee (Reg. CPR/2014/153487) since 2014, that deals with building of construction materials.
Logic: 12 years of operational history. The transition from 34 to 65 members indicates strong community integration and scalability.Organized leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: 2019 Turn Over is KSH 1,581,798 while that of 2020 is KSH 1,531,783.There is a slight drop with the turn over though they have taken measures of improving it.
Logic.2: They sell both B2B and B2C ,But luck any online sells.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their focus on producing vibrated blocks and concrete fencing posts aligns with the housing boom in Western Kenya. They accurately identify the need for modern machinery to achieve consistent product quality.No budget written down.
Logic.3: Constructions is one of the main Value Chain that is being evaluated,the only problem is that   they only do bricks making in small quantity.
Logic.4: High youth involvement (49 out of 65 members are 18–35). While they mention SDGs and green technology, the application lacks specific details on how they reduce environmental impact (e.g., use of fly ash or recycled aggregates).

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email adress given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (CPR2012/78999) established in 2012  that deals with the processing of avocado oils
Logic:
Operating since 2012 (14 years). They possess a TVETA-registered training center, KEPHIS certification, and AFA registration. This is a mature, high-compliance entity.With an organized leadership(chairperson
ceo
manager)
Logic.1: Turn Over for 2022 is KSH 2,091,468 while that for 2023 is KSH2,224,267 this shows that there is a positive trend for their sells.
Logic.2: They have a signed contract with Natural Harvest LLC (USA) for 90 tons/month. Their strategy of using reject fruits (40% of Kenya's crop) solves a massive market failure while lowering raw material costs.No online market involved.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal to acquire the Amenduni REX 250 Decanter from Italy is a game-changer. Their integration of solar water systems, 3-phase power readiness, and fiber connectivity shows they are shovel-ready for industrialization.No budget allocated.
Logic.3: Edible oils are a top KJET priority to reduce Kenya's import bill,this association deals with processing of avocado oils and selling them as ready oil for cook to their consumers.There is both dowstream and upward linkages.
Logic.4:
Shammah Agribiz has 20% Director shareholding owned by a woman and 30% out of the Board members are
women i.e 3 out of 7 board members.Their green initiatives are world-class: converting waste into biogas (30% power saving), solarized boreholes, and a planned partnership for avocado-based bio-plastics.

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email adress given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): CBO (Reg. A6972) established in 2017 that deals with processing of coffee.
A3.1 Registration & Track Record: Established in 2017 (9 years in existence) with a well structured leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: Their end year cumulative sale for 2025 is KSH 295,170 ,there is a positive trend through out the year although the cumulative sale does not add up to 1M.
Logic.2: They have a clear grasp of the different coffee grades available.Their B2C focus in local markets is a safe start, but their intent to target urban cafés and institutions shows a correct understanding of high-margin opportunities.No omline sale or international sales.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their equipment list is professional and spans the entire post-harvest cycle. Specifically, the inclusion of Moisture Meters and Raised African Drying Beds shows they prioritize quality control, which is the only way to fetch Specialty Coffee prices.They did not give exact figures for buying the equipments.
Logic.3:
main products include processed coffee, primarily clean green coffee
beans and parchment coffee, with smaller quantities of roasted and ground coffee for the local market. Sales of
processed coffee contribute approximately 65–70% of the organization’s annual turnover. Coffee processing and
value-addition services such as pulping, fermentation, washing, drying, grading, and basic packaging contribute
about 20%, while training, extension services, and community workshops on quality coffee production and
entrepreneurship account for the remaining 10–15%.

4. CONTACT INFORMATION
Primary contact details for follow-up and communication.
Logic.4:
80% of the members are women,all leaders are women,WONEP has adopted several environmentally friendly practices to ensure sustainable coffee production and
processing. The cluster promotes sun-drying on raised beds to reduce energy use and maintain coffee quality.
Water-efficient washing channels and wastewater management minimize water wastage and environmental
contamination. Coffee pulp and organic waste are composted to enrich soil naturally, while shade-grown coffee and
agroforestry practices help preserve soil fertility, prevent erosion, and support biodiversity. The cluster is exploring
solar-powered processing systems to reduce reliance on fossil fuels. Additionally, members adopt climate-smart
practices, including drought-tolerant coffee varieties, to build resilience against changing weather patterns. These
initiatives enhance environmental sustainability while improving product quality and community livelihoods

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered CBO (EMB/N/03) since 2019 that deals with planting of flowers
Logic: 5 years of operation. They have shown consistent growth in membership from 200 in 2022 to 500 in 2024, indicating strong community trust.They also have a structured leadership(chairerson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The amount in the  recipts given are too minimal
Logic.2: Their focus on Recycle and Re-use (glass and nylon) aligns perfectly with global eco-conscious trends. They have identified specific margins for each product line, showing good internal awareness of costs.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal covers a wide variety of activities (Glass, beads, weaving, knitting, nursery). This lack of specialization may be why revenue remains low. To scale, they need to focus on one  product.
Logic.3: While handicrafts are a secondary priority for KJET compared to core agrifood, their nursery activities link directly to environmental conservation and reforestation.
Logic.4: 85% youth (aged 18–35) and 68% women. Their sustainability practices—recycling glass, using organic compost, and drought-resistant seedlings—are the most comprehensive in this category

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address written
REASON(Evaluators Comments): MSME Association (Reg. 1533) established in 2023 that deals with cloth making.
Logic: Established in 2023(3 years of existence) they have doubled their employee count  from 10 to 20 in this time.They have a well structured leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: The bank statement given has transactions on for 7 months with a Turn Over of KSH 1800 as at DEC 2025.This transactions are too little to position this association financially since the transactions are not for 12 months.
Logic.2: They currently serve a local B2C market. Their plan to pivot toward schools and churches (institutional B2B) is the correct growth move, but they currently lack the standardized quality to compete with larger factories in Thika or Nairobi and they also lack the online selling site.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their problem statement is excellent. They accurately identify their weaknesses: manual processes, weak branding, and lack of standardized pricing. Their plan to invest in embroidery and overlock machines is essential for professional-grade school uniforms,their only problem is they lack the exact budget on the investments of machines.
Logic.3: Perfect alignment with the Textiles priority sector. They are focused on the "Cut-Make-Trim" (CMT) stage of the value chain they have also documented their upstream and downstream linkages.
Logic.4: 100% Women-Owned and Operated.  Their Tree Planting" initiative is a basic green practice but lacks direct linkage to their textile waste

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address written
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered SHG (DSD/14/64/01/141429) since 2019 that deals with fish farming.
Logic: 5 years of operation. They have grown their membership steadily from 30 to 43, indicating sustained community engagement and trust.They also have a well organised leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: Turn over for 2024 was KSH 249760 which is less than the 1M threshold.
Logic.2: By producing fish meal (the biggest cost in aquaculture), they are highly competitive. Their focus on the Central and Eastern regions shows a clear understanding of the high demand for fish in non-coastal regions in Kenya.They do not have any online market.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their request for an extruder and mixer is the exact technical requirement for high-quality floating fish pellets. Moving from mash to extruded pellets significantly improves fish growth rates and reduces water pollution.The only problem is they did not give the actual budget for the changes they want to make.
Logic.3: Perfect alignment with the Blue Economy priority sector, which is a key focus for food security and high-protein production.

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address written
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (PVT-27U5DDM2) established in 2023 that deals with tea farming and processing,
Logic: Regestered since 2023 with a very good transitioned from 0 to 5 employees in a year, showing rapid early-stage scaling.They also have very structured governance (chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: Revenue of KES 105k annually is quite low for a registered company. However, their profit margin is approximately 13%.
Logic.2: They are targeting health-conscious consumers and positioning themselves against giants like Coca-Cola. Their strategy to move into supermarkets via MSEA and partner with the University of Embu for research is highly advanced for an enterprise of this size.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: They aim for a KES 20M turnover by 2026. Their equipment needs (fermentation tanks, pH meters, alcohol meters) are technically correct for ensuring the safety and consistency required for KEBS/KRA compliance
Logic.3: High-value alignment. They take traditional Kenyan exports (Tea/Coffee) and process them into a secondary product (Kombucha), significantly increasing the price per unit
Logic.4: 100% of the membership is under 35. They meet all women-owned criteria. Their sustainability practices (recycling bottles, chemical-free fermentation, and 1,000+ indigenous trees planted) are excellent

IF OTHER PVC Which one?: Deals with honey harvesting since they keep bee hives.
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address written
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (PVT-Y2UZB3R) established in 2020 that deals with bee keeping amd honey harvesting with a bank statement showing all its financial records.
Logic: 6 years of operational history. They have successfully transitioned from a hobbyist level to a structured private company with a clear brand identity (Gitaru Premium Honey).They also have a structured governance(chairperson,secretary,treasurer).
Logic.1: Revenue has tripled since 2022 (KES 150k to KES 450k). Their profit margins are stable, and they provided the most comprehensive documentation (Cash flows, Bank statement) The only problem is that the revenue is is way below the 1M threshhold.
Logic.2: They emphasize Near Zero Pesticide Residual and Enzyme Preservation (low-heat warming). This technical focus allows them to charge premium prices. Their trademark registration and domain acquisition show a high level of market readiness.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The request for an electric press and automatic filling machine is logical. Currently, manual pressing limits them to 900kg/year. Automation is the only way to reach their One Tonne goal while meeting the hygiene standards required for KEBS certification
Logic.3: Bee keeping and honey harvesting is not in any of the prioritized Value Chains.
Logic.4: 100% of the leadership is under 35, and it is a majority women-owned enterprise. Their Green Initiative of replacing paraffin candles with beeswax candles is a unique and high-impact circular economy practice.

The "Return on Investment" (ROI) is not clearly articulated, and the shift toward workshop-based CNC cutting isn't tied to their current "building houses" core activity

Logic.4: 75% women representation and youth-led (30 members under 35). However, their Green Practice of using manual labor to avoid machines is counter-intuitive for a growth-oriented business and actually contradicts their request for a Bulldozer.

Logic.1: No any financial statement evidence given

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (Reg. 29843872) established in 2017 that deals with dairy farming.
Logic: Mature organization (7+ years) with a proven ability to scale. They have grown their farmer base from 400 to 800 in just two years.
Logic.1: The balance sheet shows their expenses instead of the Turn Over
Logic.2: 30% of their revenue comes from exports to East Africa. They are not just competing locally with KCC; they are playing in the artisanal, high-margin international market
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Unlike other clusters asking for machines for themselves, Browns is asking for support for their suppliers (the farmers). They recognize that their growth is capped by the quality of raw milk. However, the specific machinery for farmers isn't detailed in the cost breakdown

Logic.4: They have employed a dedicated agroecologist. Their focus on regenerative agriculture and climate resilience for dairy farmers is the "gold standard" for KJET’s green mandate.4 of 10 members are female amd 8 are young people.

Logic: they have already achieved a 300% increase in production through shared services. Their operation within a government (MSEA) worksite adds to their institutional stability
Logic.1: Handwritten financial evidence,with expenses and minimal transactions.

vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their request for pulpers, pasteurizers, and water filtering plants is perfectly aligned with their bottlenecks. Logic.4: 75% women membership and a strong youth component. Their sustainability model is a Circular Economy standout: converting processing waste into animal feed, vinegar, and wine, and creating briquettes from farm waste to save trees.

vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: They request demolition and concrete machinery to improve output. While these are relevant, the lack of a formal accounting system and the massive gap between member count and revenue makes the growth narrative hard to say its true.

Logic.1: Turn Over as Nov 2025 was KSH39000 which is way below the 1M threshhold.
Logic.2: High demand from learning institutions and hotels. Their competitive edge is being the sole regional provider in Matungu, allowing them to capture margins that would otherwise go to established companies  outside the constituency. They do not do any online trade

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Co-operative (CS/14388) since 2012 dealing with selling fried and dried fish which falls under blue economy.
Logic: Established in 2012. A 14-year history of organizing fish farmers in Kakamega demonstrates high resilience and institutional maturity . It also has a structured organisation(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: Did not give any financial evidence to show that the association is running
Logic.2: High local demand , They effectively identify the main threat: cheaper protein alternatives like chicken. Their plan to pivot into "Fish Balls and Fingers" is a smart move toward higher-margin, convenient processed foods
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Strategic focus on Cold Chain Logistics and Digital Ecosystems. Their plan to secure an accounting package is vital given their massive membership size. The target to collect 3 tonnes of fish is ambitious but realistic if logistics are solved, good plan with no budget seems challenging.
Logic.3: Complete value chain coverage: aggregation, primary processing (drying/frying), secondary value addition (planned fish balls), and equipment supply (fishing gears), they do not have a downward stream to get 5 points.
Logic.4: They are implementing pond liners, solar-powered aerators, and rainwater harvesting—essential technologies for climate-resilient aquaculture. Membership is 33% female.

Logic: Established in 2016. A 10-year track record indicates very high social cohesion and resilience, specifically as a support system for widows
Logic.1: we can not tell their financial records since the mpesa statement is locked
Logic.2: 100% local sales. Their competitiveness stems from a "Success Story" brand and community trust. They have strategic linkages with Bukura Institute of Agriculture and Bungoma County for seed supply, which is a major competitive advantage for quality control.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: There is a significant strategic mismatch in the proposal. While they are in the Edible Oils value chain, they are asking for a Tractor and a Posho Mill (for flour). A posho mill supports the Maize value chain, not Edible Oils. To grow in their primary sector, they should be requesting oil pressers or peanut butter processing equipment.
Logic.3: Strong alignment with groundnuts and soybeans. However, they are currently acting more as a "Grain and Pulse" group rather than an "Oil" group.
Logic.4: 92% Female, specifically targeting widows . They have also uniquely integrated "widowed men." Their sustainability practices are excellent, using a "Circular Economy" approach where crop waste is recycled into manure and animal feed.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered MSME Association since 2016 doing dairy farming and a bank statement has been submitted to act as financial evidence.

Logic.1: 2024 Revenue is KES 60,000. For a group of 25 members, this is extremely low (KES 2,400 per member per year). While revenue is growing (50% increase since 2022), the absolute volume suggests this is a secondary income activity for members
Logic.2: Currently 100% local sales. Operating at a "Boda Boda stage" provides a unique high-traffic point for local commuters, but they lack formal sales structures or value-added products
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal to transition to modern technology (milking machines, freezers) is standard, but the group's current scale makes such investments difficult to justify without a massive increase in herd size. Use of QuickBooks is a surprising and highly positive administrative strength.
Logic.3: Primarily a production-focused group using "local breeds." They have not yet reached the aggregation or processing stages of the value chain.
Logic.4: The group is 100% Male (25 men, 0 women). Furthermore, while they started with 20 youth in 2022, they reported 0 youth for 2023 and 2024, which is a significant demographic data error or indicates a loss of youth members.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Meets registration, location, financial evidence, and contact criteria.
Logic: Registered in 2022 (3+ years), fully operational with director, manager, and treasurer. Young enterprise but has an organized leadership structure. Moderate operational history.
Logic.1: The reported revenue has consistently increased from KES 2M (2022) to KES 5M (2024). The profits are positive, though in 2024 profits are recorded as KES 100,000. The profits are 15-20% of production costs. The cluster uses a simple accounting app: "Daily Sales Record," which also offers bank statements for 2025 only
Logic.2: B2B sales comprise 30%, which includes agrovet shops and milk cooling plants, while B2C sales comprise 70%, which are directed towards farmers. This cluster has a well-defined marketing plan for new markets and reduced dependence on middlemen. Competitors in this industry are Sigma Feeds, Unga Feeds, and Kilimo Feeds.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The cluster has defined clear goals: deliver quality and affordable feeds, achieve 10% growth annually in mature markets, and engage at least 10 farmers in new areas. The challenges include cash flow, marketing, and machinery. The proposed solutions include B2C and sourcing raw materials locally.
Logic.3: The cluster plays a processing role in its PVC but is not part of a priority KJET value chain.
Logic.4: Women are represented in the accountant and sales positions. Youth are represented indirectly through the B2C interaction with farmers. Green initiatives include assisting farmers in planting soybeans and sunflower for oil and cakes in animal feeds.

Logic.1: Revenues are consistently high (KES 155M → 239M). Profits are low (KES 58k → 24k), indicating thin margin. Financial stability is supported by continuous high turnover and operational scale.
Logic.2: 80% B2C and 20% B2B market mix, with consistent sales to KCC and supermarkets. Market demand is stable, and cooperative leverages member aggregation for competitive advantage.

Logic.1: Revenue shows strong growth (KES 12.86M → 30.69M), but profit margins are very thin (KES 56k → 8.9k), indicating tight financial buffer and operational constraints. Evidence of consistent income confirms operational activity.

Logic.4: Women represented in leadership (chairperson, treasurer), youth actively engaged. Sustainable practices include promotion of fodder, silage, manure management, climate-smart dairy training, energy-efficient milk cooling, and water conservation.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered cooperative established 1973; registration certificate provided. Fully compliant.Bank statements, balance sheets submitted
Logic: Well-established cooperative since 1973 with decades of experience in coffee processing. Stable governance with chairperson, secretary, manager, and treasurer. Long operational history gives high credibility.
Logic.1: Revenues increasing steadily (KES 23.4M → 29.7M), profits modest but positive (KES 379k → 443k). Strong financial footprint relative to local cooperatives. Dependence on seasonal coffee markets noted.
Logic.2: 100% B2B sales to Nairobi Coffee Exchange and local processors. High demand through established auction and direct sales channels. Competitive advantage through quality control, farmer engagement, and ICT adoption.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Clear plans for expansion, processing infrastructure upgrades, ICT adoption, and market development locally and internationally. Investment plans for machinery, drying beds, and traceability systems are realistic and aligned with growth objectives.
Logic.3: Core role in coffee VC which includes raw cherry collection, processing, drying, grading, and marketing. Strong backward linkages with smallholder farmers. Provides essential aggregation function, ensuring supply continuity.
Logic.4: Not women-owned, but cooperative engages farmers inclusively, including youth. Sustainability initiatives include solar energy, biogas, organic manure, agroforestry, water recycling, eco-friendly drying, and climate-smart agriculture training. Environmentally responsible practices embedded.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Cooperative legally registered, active operations, documents verified, aligns with eligibility requirements. balance sheets sufficient.
Logic: Cooperative established in 1999; over 25 years of operation. Leadership structure defined (chairperson, secretary, manager, treasurer). Track record solid but smaller scale compared to older or larger cooperatives.
Logic.1: Annual revenue modest (KES 4.1–4.3M), profits improving (KES 16k → 186k). Financial footprint smaller than other Kericho coffee cooperatives, which may limit expansion without support.
Logic.2: B2C focused (80%) with some B2B sales (20%). Main buyers are local supermarkets and village-level consumers; limited export or high-value market access. Competition from neighboring societies noted.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Growth plans focus on farmer training, local consumption promotion, and value addition. Infrastructure gaps (drying tables, processing equipment) need investment. Proposal feasible but dependent on BDS support.
Logic.3: Plays a key aggregation role in coffee VC for local farmers. Processes and markets coffee at the community level. Limited processing capacity compared to larger cooperatives.
Logic.4: Women ownership ~30%, which meets KJET criteria. Sustainable practices implemented include solar energy, biogas, organic manure, agroforestry, and farmer training. Environmentally conscious.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered cooperative, established 2018; registration certificate provided. Balance sheets and income statements submitted
Logic: Cooperative is relatively young but shows rapid growth in membership (502 → 1,491) and service diversification. Leadership structure defined and includes a female manager, supporting women ownership criteria.
Logic.1: Revenue fluctuates KES 162.9M (2022) → 119.3M (2024); profits thin but positive (KES 149k in 2024).
Logic.2: Strong mix of B2B (60%) and B2C (40%) sales. Buyers include local supermarkets, hotels, institutions, and retail consumers. Value-added products (Mursik, yoghurt) are growing. Competition exists from national brands and local processors, but integrated service model is unique.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Expansion plans for a full processing plant, cold storage, packaging, and brand development are realistic and aligned with growth targets. Investment in digitization and operational efficiency noted.
Logic.3: raw milk collection, feed production, AI & veterinary services, processing, transport, and marketing. Captures significant value across multiple nodes of the dairy value chain.
Logic.4: Women ownership >20% and female manager in leadership. Sustainability initiatives include biogas, tree planting, manure management, local fodder promotion, water conservation, and climate-resilient practices.

E5. Consent & Contactability: Phone numbers, email provided; T&C accepted.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): meets all registration, location, VC alignment, financial documentation, and consent criteria. Despite being a young CBO (established 2022), it shows growth, clear VC focus, and operational structure.
Logic: Tavoni C.B.O is recently established (2022) but demonstrates strong organization and member growth (109 → 140 members over 3 years). Leadership structure is complete with active chairperson, secretary, and treasurer. While it lacks a long historical track record like older cooperatives, its consistent reporting, member mobilization, and governance show emerging institutional capacity.
Logic.2: The CBO has clear B2C (70%) and B2B (30%) channels, supplying local households and small retailers. Demand for sunflower oil is high in Kitui and surrounding areas. Competitors likely exist (other small oil processors and traders), but Tavoni C.B.O’s emerging aggregation and value addition approach positions it to scale. Market access could be strengthened through KJET support.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Proposed plans include acquiring oil extraction machinery, expanding production, introducing a poultry incubator, and improving transport and logistics. These plans are feasible given current operations and align with growth and income-generation objectives. Practical investments are identified, and scaling potential is clear.
Logic.3: Tavoni operates multiple stages in the edible oil value chain: seed aggregation, cleaning, drying, oil extraction, packaging, and sale of by-products. This vertical integration captures more value for members and enhances control over product quality. The cluster is positioned to expand into larger markets if BDS support is provided.
Logic.4: Women represent a significant portion of membership (exact percentage not given), but leadership roles are currently held by a female chairperson and treasurer. Sustainable practices include tree planting for carbon credit. While initial steps toward ESG compliance are evident, broader environmental, social, and governance initiatives could be strengthened for higher scoring.

E5. Consent & Contactability: Primary and alternate phone numbers, email, and acceptance of KJET terms provided. Cluster is contactable and cooperative.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): meets all registration, location, VC alignment, financial documentation, and consent criteria. It demonstrates a functional structure, emerging financial record-keeping, and a clear operational focus in milk production.
Logic: The cooperative is very young (est. 2023) with only 34 members and 3 employees. Governance structure exists with female-led management (chairperson and treasurer), but historical performance and long-term track record are limited. Demonstrates initial organizational capacity, but stability and scalability are still emerging.
Logic.1: Revenue and profit are positive but very low (KES 2,988–3,488 revenue; KES 2,000–3,000 profit). Margins for goat milk (~30–35%) and live goats (~25–30%) are reasonable, but the absolute financial scale is small, limiting immediate reinvestment capacity. Basic financial records are maintained, but no formal accounting system is used.
Logic.2: Cluster has a balanced B2B (50%) and B2C (50%) approach, supplying households and hotels. Competition exists from small-scale farmers, private processors, and commercial dairy brands. Niche advantage lies in fresh, locally sourced goat milk. Market potential is moderate, and scaling would require infrastructure and market linkage support.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Plans include expanding goat herd, upgrading milk cooling and pasteurization, and introducing value-added products like yoghurt and flavored milk. Growth plan is realistic but dependent on access to equipment, technical training, and market linkages. Demonstrates potential to scale with structured support.
Logic.3: Covers key stages: goat rearing, milk production, processing, and packaging. While the cluster does not yet operate at full capacity or in distribution beyond hotels/households, its role in linking production to end consumers is clear and relevant within the dairy VC.
Logic.4: Women-led enterprise with chairperson, secretary, and treasurer being female. Sustainable practices implemented include water conservation, waste management, energy efficiency, drought resilience measures, and tree planting/agroforestry. Demonstrates a strong foundation for ESG practices relative to scale and age.

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: Bank statements and basic financial books provided.
E5. Consent & Contactability: Phone numbers, email, and acceptance of KJET terms provided. Cluster is fully contactable.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): The cooperative is newly established but demonstrates proper registration, clear VC alignment, operational reach, financial activity, it fulfills all legal, geographic, and operational requirements.
Logic: Established in 2023, MWINGI Artisanal Miners CS has a very short operational history. Membership is growing (50 → 70 members), but stability and long-term performance are yet to be proven. Leadership includes women (2 of 6 top officials), indicating inclusivity, but overall organizational track record is limited.
Logic.1: Revenue and profits are positive but small (KES 100,000–150,000 revenue; KES 60,000–84,000 profit). Margins on copper and mica (~50–120%) suggest profitable operations at small scale. No formal accounting system is used, limiting detailed financial planning.
Logic.2: Cooperative addresses market gaps caused by unscrupulous middlemen. Provides technical support to artisanal miners, facilitating supply of copper, mica, iron ore, limestone, quartz, and gemstones. Market potential is moderate, with niche advantage in legitimacy, community trust, and technical advisory access. Sales channels, however, are underdeveloped and lack formal B2B/B2C structure.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Plans include gemology lab, mechanized extraction equipment (excavator, lorry, 4WD, jackhammers), and value addition. Proposal is realistic and addresses current gaps in production quality, safety, and marketability. Scaling potential depends on equipment, training, and market linkages.
Logic.3: Covers full artisanal mining value chain: mineral identification, consent agreements, extraction, transport, and marketing. Provides technical support to members. Well-aligned with VC objectives, although the cluster currently operates at small scale with limited formalized downstream linkages.
Logic.4: Women represent 2 of 6 top officials; 12–8 female membership in 2024. Sustainability initiatives include tree planting, reclamation of mined pits, soil conservation, and support for tree nurseries. Demonstrates early adoption of ESG practices and environmental stewardship.

IF OTHER PVC Which one?: Operates as a micro enterprise providing business services and youth empowerment activities in Mwingi town. Focused on community development and technology support,
E5. Consent & Contactability: Phone numbers, email, and acceptance of KJET terms provided; cluster is fully contactable.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Legally compliant and operational, but VC not aligned with KJET priority.
Logic: Registered sole proprietorship since 2021 with basic compliance. However, governance structure is minimal (single director) and limited operational history is demonstrated beyond offering general services.
Logic.1: Revenues show growth from KES 20,000 (2022) to KES 200,000 (2024), indicating some upward trend. However, figures are low-scale, unsupported by detailed financial statements, and liquidity position is unclear.
Logic.2: Market demand not clearly articulated. No specific products/services, buyers, contracts, or repeat customers identified. Competition described generically as “other established firms” without evidence of market positioning.

MSHCSL is the only registered cooperative in the larger Mwingi region controlling sand harvesting, giving it regulatory and operational advantage. Potential to scale exists with proper infrastructure and marketing support.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Comprehensive plan for value addition: packaged sand, cabro blocks, electricity poles, fencing poles, and sand-based cottage industries. Plans include acquisition of sand packaging plant (KES 9.95M), lorries, loaders, IT infrastructure, and hiring 100 permanent employees plus 400 casuals. Growth plan is feasible but relies on access to finance and technical support.
Logic.3: Covers full sand value chain: extraction, processing, packaging, and distribution. Includes coordination with riparian groups and organized sand loaders, creating a regulated, compliant supply chain. Cooperative manages sand yards and depots, fully aligned with KJET construction VC objectives.
Logic.4: Women-led management (40% executive roles). Membership includes 33% women. Sustainable practices include EIAs, tree planting, sand management levies, solar-powered operations, and community support programs. Compliance with NEMA and county regulations ensures social and environmental responsibility.

Expansion strategy includes exhibitions and online marketing, though detailed financial projections are limited.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (No. 926) established in 1962 operating in the Dairy value chain in Central Imenti, Meru. Registration certificate and balance sheet attached; terms accepted with valid contact details provided. Meets all eligibility requirements and proceeds to primary scoring.
Logic: Established in 1962 with strong operational continuity and significant growth in membership (2,331 in 2022 to 2,845 in 2024) and employees (13 to 22). Long-standing dairy aggregation model supplying union demonstrates institutional stability.
Logic.1: Strong revenue growth (KES 263M in 2022; KES 344M in 2023; KES 412M in 2024) supported by attached balance sheet. Profit margins are modest (8%) and declined significantly in 2024, indicating operational pressure despite high turnover.
Logic.2: 100% B2B sales to Meru Dairy Co-operative Union with daily collection of 23,000 litres against 11,000-litre chilling capacity, demonstrating strong demand. Competition mainly from brokers/middlemen, but cooperative retains advantage through timely payments and check-off system.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Clear production target (27,000–30,000 litres/day by 2026) with defined quarterly and monthly performance reviews. Expansion plan includes additional chilling capacity, vehicles, office expansion, and working capital support.
Logic.3: Well-integrated dairy aggregation cooperative handling collection, cooling, logistics, agrovet supply, and extension services. Strong backward linkages with feed manufacturers and forward linkage to dairy union.
Logic.4: Women constitute 60% of membership with board representation (3/10 directors). Adoption of biodigesters, solar heating/cooling solutions, and solar irrigation demonstrates active environmental sustainability initiatives.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (CS/106/10679) established in 2005, operating in the Coffee value chain in South Imenti, Meru County. Registration certificate, bank statements, and balance sheets attached. Accepted KJET terms, has defined contact details, and meets all eligibility requirements for cohort 2.
Logic: Established in 2005, steady membership growth from 3,145 (2022) to 3,338 (2024), with stable staffing (13 employees). Governance structure includes chairperson, secretary, CEO, and treasurer, with monthly management monitoring and external audits.

Logic.2: Coffee accounts for 95% of turnover; sales are B2C to dealers at Nairobi Coffee Exchange. Main competitors are other cooperatives in Meru and private estates, with competition for membership loyalty and marketing channels. Strong integration of procurement, processing, and marketing enhances competitiveness.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Plans include modernizing pulping, drying, storage facilities, bulk input procurement, training, and market expansion to specialty and international buyers. Clear objectives, performance monitoring, and structured member participation in decision-making.
Logic.3: Integrated across procurement, processing, and marketing. Provides inputs, transport, financial management, and training. Strong backward linkages with local input suppliers and forward linkage to millers/export agents.
Logic.4: Women represent ~600 members out of total membership, contributing to ownership. Sustainability initiatives include organic manure, soil conservation, water harvesting, shade trees, and climate-smart training for farmers.

Logic.2: They have a clear B2B model (100%), selling to authorized government marketing agents to bypass exploitative middlemen. This strategy professionalizes the artisanal sector in Migori, they do not have any knowledge of online trade.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal seeks heavy machinery, While these are essential for "Value Addition" in mining, the costs listed (approx. KES 1M for a compressor) may exceed individual cluster grant caps and require a more detailed technical feasibility study,they did not clearly list the risk involved in all this investment.
Logic.3: They mine and also buy from local miners the gold and sell them to the goverment for processing which is their largest buyer which clearly shows linkage between local miners and the processers(the government)
Logic.4: 62.5% of the 240 members are women, and 58% are youth. This is exceptionally rare for the mining sector, which is traditionally male-dominated. Their commitment to NEMA guidelines and reforestation of degraded mine sites is excellent.

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (PVT-LRU5GXL) registered in 2018  that deals with coffee testing and processing
Logic: Operating since 2018 (8 years). They have a proven history of delivering consultancy and training services to NGOs, County Governments, and farmer groups, they have a well organised leadership strructure all the way from CEO to Treasurer
Logic.1: The transaction costs in the bank statement given are not visible enough so i can not tell the exact amount is transited hence can not tell the actuall Turn Over
Logic.2: Strong market positioning. They differentiate through Regenerative Coffee Production and specialized QC services (cupping/moisture analysis). Their B2B (58%) and B2C (42%) split shows a balanced revenue stream,they are yet to introduc online marketing.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The investment plan for a modern QC lab, automated packaging, and IoT sensors for storage shows a clear path toward professionalizing the Migori coffee sector the problem is they did not clearly sate what their budget is.
Logic.3: They address critical "Missing Middle" services in the coffee chain: quality testing, traceability, and regenerative production training
Logic.4: They are pioneers in Syntropic Farming and Agroforestry for coffee. The leadership is 80% women-led (including CEO and Treasurer), exceeding all gender inclusivity benchmarks.

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: yes- a balne sheet and cash book have been submitted as proof
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes- phone number and email address have been given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (CS/5474) since 1988 deals with buying milk from local farmers and taking it to processing
Logic: Established in 1988. This is one of the most established cooperatives in the region, demonstrating long-term institutional stability and community trust and it also has a structured governance(chaiperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The cash book shows a drop of income in 2024 the Turn Over was KSH1985760 while in 2025 the Turn Over was KSH1620652 this shows the business experienced a very significant loss. The turn over was more than 1M
Logic.2: Strong B2B focus (80%). They have successfully identified their niche in institutional markets. Their price margins for value-added products like Yogurt (35%) and Mala (30%) are healthy, but they need to shift more of their volume into these categories to offset raw milk competition and also start selling their yoghurt and mala online
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal to invest in Bulk Milk Coolers , solar-powered cooling, and a refrigerated delivery vehicle addresses their "Problem Statement" directly. The inclusion of digital solutions for farmer payments is a critical step toward modernization.The only problem is they did not ive the exact budget needed for all this to be met.
Logic.3: Complete vertical integration. They handle procurement, processing (Yogurt/Mala), and distribution.It is a complete circle with both upstream and downstream linkages.
Logic.4: 54% female membership and a strong youth component (693 members aged 18–35). Their Green Initiatives—recycling whey into animal feed and pilot solar cooling—are industry best practices for the Blue/Green Economy

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: No- Did not give any financial evidence
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes- phone number and email address have been given.
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Cooperative (C5/20389) established in 2016 that deals with coffee planting and buying from local farmers and send it to processing.
Logic: Operating since 2016. This 10-year track record indicates significant institutional maturity and successful navigation of the coffee regulatory environment in Kenya and it also has an organised structure(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The association did not give any financial proof of their yearly transaction hence we can not proof their financial position
Logic.2: 80% B2B sales primarily to the Nairobi Coffee Exchange. Their Organic and Regenerative branding gives them a major competitive edge in the specialty coffee market, which attracts higher premiums than conventional coffee their only problem is they havent started doing online sells.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea:
The request for Modern Coffee Pulping Equipment is logical. Upgrading from basic pulping to eco-pulpers would reduce water usage and improve bean quality.

The proposal is slightly thin on specific Operational Enhancements but clear on the need for capital to upscale.Another thing they did not  state is their budget of all the equipments that they would like to buy.
Logic.3: Well-aligned. They cover the full spectrum from seedling provision and capacity building to primary processing (pulping) and marketing green beans.They also carry out the whole upward and downward stream since they interact eith the local farmers and their final buyers for the processed coffee.
Logic.4: 51% women-owned/led.hey are actively practicing Regenerative Farming and Riverbank Restoration (River Nyasore). The Forest Coffee model is one of the highest forms of climate-smart agriculture

IF OTHER PVC Which one?: Deals with bananas(making crisps,fibre and eco bags)
E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: no-bank statement with few transactions attached
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address are given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (CS/30073) established in 2024 that deals with banana products production.
Logic: Formally registered in 2024. While they have rapid growth, they lack the multi-year institutional history of older cooperatives (3 years and above). They are in the "High-Growth Startup" phase.
Logic.1: The bank statement given only has transactions for the first 4 months of the year 2025 ,these traansactions are too little to position this group financially since the requirement was atleast a 1 year transaction.
Logic.2: They are targeting high-growth niche markets: Gluten-free flour, Eco-bags, and—most notably—Banana Fibre for Hair Extensions. This is a brilliant strategic move to disrupt the synthetic hair market with a sustainable, locally-sourced alternative.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their plan to utilize 100% of the banana plant (fruit for food, stem for fiber, waste for compost) is a model of the "Circular Economy." Their specific equipment list (decorticators, fermentation tanks, oil filtration) is technically precise and well-justified.Their only problem is they do not have any documented budget in the records.
Logic.3: They address every stage of the KJET priority areas: aggregation, primary processing, high-value manufacturing, and niche market branding.They have both the upstream and downstream linkages.The only problem is they are dealing with banana products which does not fall in any VC.
Logic.4: 60% women members with active leadership in management and procurement committees. Their "Environmental Stewardship" is baked into their business model through the replacement of synthetic hair and plastic bags with banana fiber products

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address are given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Self-Help Group (108111/2012) since 2012 thatndeals with dairy activities.
Logic: Operating since 2012 with a working leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The bank statement only shows the transactions for 1st,2nd,3rd december of 2024 ,these transactions are too few to position this group finaancially since they were required to atleast submit a 1 year transaction history.
Logic.2: They have a clear understanding of their local market (B2C) and the competition from branded dairy companies. Their competitive edge is freshness and community ties. Their ghee product (KES 400 per 250ml) is a high-margin value-add
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The request for a milk cooling unit, chaff cutters, and mala/yogurt processing units is the perfect "next step" for a group of this size. Moving from raw milk to value-added products (Yogurt/Mala) will double their margins
Logic.3: Strongly aligned. They are addressing the "Support Service" and "Processing" gaps in the Nyatike dairy sector
Logic.4: 80% youth (16/20 members) and 70% women (14/20). Their sustainability practices are highly articulated: Zero-grazing, Fodder conservation  and Solar lighting

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: yes-A SEP and DEC bank statement attached
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address are given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (PVT_6LUK2A6Y) established in 2022 that deals with dairy feeds production and fish feeds production.
Logic: Regestered since 2022(3 years in operation) with a very structured leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The bank statement given only has transactions for Sep and Dec only.This transactions are too few to know the financial position of the group.
Logic.2: They are competing with giants like Unga Limited by offering "Last-Mile" convenience. Their unique value proposition—allowing farmers to bring their own raw materials for custom milling—is a highly effective strategy for the rural Migori context.They do not havee any online store selling.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The plan to expand into Poultry, Fish, and Rabbit feeds is perfectly timed. Migori's Blue Economy needs local, affordable fish pellets to be viable. Their request for "appropriate equipment" to replace low-capacity 10HP machines is technically sound but the only problem is they do not have the actual budget needed for the machinery.
Logic.3: They are a Value Chain Enabler, Without local feed centers like this, the Dairy and Blue Economy sectors in Suna West would remain dependent on expensive imports from Nakuru or Nairobi, though the linkage is peripheral
Logic.4: 50% Women-owned. Their Green Initiative is a standout: they are actively working to transition farmers away from Tobacco (which degrades soil and requires high wood-fuel for curing) toward Soya and Sunflower, which are nitrogen-fixing and environmentally friendly

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address are given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): MSME Association/CBO (NTK/CBO/026/2014) since 2014 that deals with processing of sunflower seeds in to sunflower oil.
Logic: 12 years of operation since 2014. This indicates long-term resilience and deep-rooted community trust in Nyatike and it also has well structured leadership role(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: The balance as at the end of the bank statement is KSH57,031,281 which is a very good turn over since it is above the 10M threshhold
Logic.2: They have a high B2C capture (97%), meaning they are the primary oil source for their local community. By selling 100% of their finished oil locally, they bypass high distribution costs and tap into the national trend of rising cooking oil prices , the only problem they have is that they do not have any online store
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their biggest bottleneck is the "Third-Party Dependency" for oil extraction at Kiranda. The proposal to purchase an in-house oil press and filtration equipment will allow them to capture the 25–30% value-addition margin they currently share with contractors and another problem is they have no any working budget neither do they have any accounted budget.
Logic.3: Fully integrated. They manage everything from land preparation and cultivation (60% turnover) to processing and retail sales
Logic.4: 61% of members are youth (48/78) and 56% are women. Their "Circular Economy" approach—reusing seed husks for animal feed and organic compost—is an industry gold standard for sustainability

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (C/S28848) established in 2023 and deals with supporting  members through agricultural line of credit
Logic: Established in 2023.(3 years of existence) and have a well structured leadership(chairperson,secretary,treasurer)
Logic.1: There was no no any financial statement given by the association so we can no t tell their transaactions.
Logic.2: They address a massive local gap: access to credit for smallholders. Their competitive advantage is "Local Context" and "Low Interest Rates" compared to mainstream banks. Their pivot toward tomato cold storage is highly strategic given the perishability of the crop in Nyatike
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The proposal to move from pure credit into Poultry Feed Formulation and Cold Storage is a logical vertical integration. This transforms them from a simple lender into a value-chain aggregator,their only problem is they do not know exactly how much is neded for the transition.
Logic.3: They act as an enabler for multiple value chains (Tomatoes, Poultry). While they selected "Other," their actual impact supports the Dairy (feed) and Horticulture (tomatoes) sectors through giving them funds.
Logic.4: 64% of their members are youth (18–35), and 63% are women.  Their use of solar energy and Farm Managed Natural Regeneration for sustainability is highly commendable.

E4. Minimum Financial Evidence: yes-a ledgerbook is given as the financial statement
E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone number and email address are given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (CS/23226) established in 2018 focusing in coffee planting and processing.
Logic: Established in 2018. A 7-year track record shows stability and experience in organizing Kuria coffee farmers with a very organised leadership structure(chairperson,secretary,treasurer,manager)
Logic.1: Turn over in NOV 2025 IS KSH1173300 which is a drop compared to that of JUNE 2025 which was KSH 2,031,462 shown in the ledger book,the statement also shows that the loss is recovering
Logic.2: Very vague responses ("Well measured," "To sell out sides Kenya"). While coffee has high demand, the cooperative failed to describe its specific market channels, buyer types, or how it competes with larger millers
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The application lacks a clear investment plan. Under "critical equipment," they listed "Pucking and selling" (likely meant "plucking"). There is no mention of pulping machines, drying beds, or moisture meters which are essential for coffee quality.
Logic.3: They are aligned with the coffee sector, but their activity description is minimal ("coffee market and togetherness"). They need to define if they are aggregators of cherry or if they handle primary processing
Logic.4: 68% of the 489 members are women. They also have a significant number of youth and elderly members. Their commitment to "Tree seedlings planting" aligns with green initiatives, though it lacks detail

REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Cooperative (CS/26372) since 2021 and deals with processsing of fibre from bananas hence the textile industry
Logic: Operating since 2021 and a whole set of prophesional leaders(chaiperson,treasurer,secretary)
Logic.1: Turn over for 2023 was KSH 5,314,364 and that of 2024 was KSH 4,918263 which is a significant loss according to the balaance sheet.
Logic.2: They have a balanced B2B/B2C split (50/50). By targeting "Slow Fashion" and eco-décor, they avoid competing with cheap synthetic imports and instead compete in premium value tiers,their only problem is they have not ventured in online sells.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their  Moving from manual decortication to semi-automatic machines will triple output. Their plan for a natural dyeing unit significantly increases the value of their finished woven goods. the issue is they have no plan on how they will carry out their moving,no budget
Logic.3: They have three priority areas: Waste-to-Wealth, Women's Empowerment, and Export-Oriented Manufacturing hence the upward and downward downstream.
Logic.4: 80% women-owned and 70% women-led. Their intercropping with Indigenous Leafy Vegetables  adds a food security layer to their textile business. This "Zero-Waste" system is exactly what is referred to as green practicess

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone numbers and emil address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Registered Youth Group (YG/01637/2020) since 2020 that deals with  poultry farming and counselling.
Logic: 4 years of operation. They have successfully transitioned from a startup to a growth-phase enterprise with a clear leadership hierarchy (CEO, Director, Manager).
Logic.1: Turn over by Feb 2025 was 1.2M KSH which lies between the range of 1M-5M
Logic.2: They have a  competitive strategy. By offering brooding services (rearing chicks past the fragile day-old stage), they solve the 1 cause of failure for poultry farmers (mortality). Their 85% B2C focus shows strong local brand penetration.They do not do online marketing
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: The plan to move into incubation (to control supply) and feed formulation (to control costs) is the classic path to poultry profitability. Their focus on F1 breeds (Kenchic/Kukuchic) ensures high quality over cheap, undocumented imports.The plan misses a very important aspect which is the budget or any systemic calculation to show the exact amount needed.
Logic.3: directly addresses the Livestock priority sector with a heavy focus on Value Addition (slaughtering/packaging) and Technical Services
Logic.4: 100% Youth-Led. 52% women membership. Their Green credentials are top-tier: they are already implementing Black Soldier Fly  and Azolla farming to reduce reliance on expensive commercial feeds

E5. Consent & Contactability: yes-phone numbers and emil address given
REASON(Evaluators Comments): Private Company (CPR/2013/94981) established in 2013 that deals with  processing banana waste in to fibre for making textiles, hair extensions, vegan leather, bioplastics, and organic fertilizers.
Logic: Regestered since 2013 with a very organized leadership consisting of chaiperson,treasurer and secretary.
Logic.1: Turn Over of KSH 11,652,402 as at 2025 and there is a positive 2 year positive trend since the Turn Over for 2024 was KSH 2,109,504
Logic.2: 20% of their revenue is from exports to Canada. They are not just selling locally; they are meeting international standards for Vegan Leather and Bioplastics,positioning them at the forefront of the global cleantech market.
vague plans, no detailed targets, unclea: Their request for KES 20M for fiber extraction for textiles and hair extensions is well-supported by their existing Benefit-Cost Ratios  of up to 3.25:1. They are moving into Biorefinery concepts, which is the most advanced form of agricultural value addition.
Logic.3: They serve as an aggregator for the Wefahson Banana Farmers Cooperative, creating backward linkages that directly boost farmer profits by an estimated 17%.
Logic.4: 80% women-owned and 70% women-managed. They have doubled their employee count from 17 to 42 in just two years. Their Zero Waste model is the definition of environmental sustainability

Logic.4: Near gender parity (134Female/145Male) is excellent. However,  only 4 out of 279 members are under 35 years old (1.4%). The cooperative is aging out. Their green initiatives (Calliandra/Sesbania fodder and avocados) are strong environmental markers
